item.title: Linda add a quote by Elizabeth Gaskell
item.description: "People may flatter themselves just as much by thinking that their faults are always present to other people's minds, as if they believe that the world is always contemplating their individual charms and virtues." -- Elizabeth Gaskell

item.title: Linda add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "This is my letter to the world That never wrote to me" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Linda add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Four be the things I'd have been better without: love, curiosity, freckles and doubt." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Linda add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "The heart of another is a dark forest, always, no matter how close it has been to one’s own." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Linda add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description:
"I'm nobody! Who are you? Are you nobody, too? Then there ’s a pair of us—don’t tell! They ’d banish us, you know.
How dreary to be somebody! How public, like a frog To tell your name the livelong day To an admiring bog!" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Linda add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "The heart has its reasons which reason knows not." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Linda add a quote by Jean Anouilh
item.description: "There is love of course. And then there's life, its enemy." -- Jean Anouilh

item.title: Linda add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "There are, that resting, rise. Can I expound the skies? How still the riddle lies!" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Linda add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "I am still of [the] opinion that only two topics can be of the least interest to a serious and studious mood--sex and the dead." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Linda add a quote by Diane Arbus
item.description: "There's a quality of legend about freaks. Like a person in a fairy tale who stops you and demands that you answer a riddle. Most people go through life dreading they'll have a traumatic experience. Freaks were born with their trauma. They've already passed their test in life. They're aristocrats." -- Diane Arbus

item.title: Linda add a quote by Pirandello
item.description: "Each of us, face to face with other men, is clothed with some sort of dignity, but we know only too well all the unspeakable things that go on in the heart." -- Pirandello

item.title: Linda add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "As for me, I am a watercolor. I wash off." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Linda add a quote by Havelock Ellis
item.description: "The place where optimism most flourishes is the lunatic asylum." -- Havelock Ellis

item.title: Linda add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "When the body escaped mutilation, seldom did the heart go to the grave unscarred." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Linda add a quote by Charlie Chaplin
item.description: "In the end, everything is a gag." -- Charlie Chaplin

item.title: Linda add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Saying nothing sometimes says the most." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Linda add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "Your life story would not make a good book. Don’t even try." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Linda add a quote by Guillaume Apollinaire
item.description: "When man wanted to make a machine that would walk he created the wheel, which does not resemble a leg. " -- Guillaume Apollinaire

item.title: Linda add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "There are many humorous things in the world; among them, the white man's notion that he is less savage than the other savages." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Linda add a quote by Thornton Wilder
item.description: "I think that it can be assumed that no adults are ever really 'shocked' - that being shocked is always a pose." -- Thornton Wilder

item.title: Linda add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Enlightened people seldom or never possess a sense of responsibility. " -- George Orwell
